page.title: 01MUNDON AND THE BLACKWATER
page.content: GENERAL SURVEY On the 1st July 1985 we did our part of the Domesday Survey. The area we covered was farmland in Mundon which is situated about 4 miles south of Maldon,the nearest town.We also surveyed part of the Blackwater Estuary and Osea island. Much of the farmland we covered is very low-lying and flooding used to be a great problem. The last major flood was in 1956. After this the Water Authority built up the seawall which is about 7 miles long. Flooding is no longer a problem. Much of what is now farmland had to be reclaimed from the sea and there is still quite a lot of marshland in this area. The Blackwater Estuary covers much of our area and the population is very small - about 30 people in total. by Harriet, Trudi, Emma & Richard.
